result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leon Alonzo Frazier

Defendant Leon Alonzo Frazier appeared by video.  Attorney Nicole A. Muller appeared by video for Leon Alonzo Frazier.  Attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Mueller was just appointed to the case and is requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 11-11-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:

Defendant Leon Alonzo Frazier appeared by video.  Attorney Nicole A. Muller appeared by video for Leon Alonzo Frazier.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Motion to Substitution Attorney.  Attorney Nicole Muller is now the attorney of record.  Attorney Hailstock has withdrawn from the case. 
Jury trial scheduled for 9-21-22 is vacated.  Case is adjourned to 10-13-22 at 8:30 am for status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:

Defendant Leon Alonzo Frazier in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Final Pre-Trial. All parties appeared via zoom. Case remains in trial posture. Final pre-trial discussions held. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 09/21/2022 at 8:30 am in Branch 10.

Defendant Leon Alonzo Frazier in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 8-15-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 9-21-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered the $500.00 cash bail be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of  any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with T.L.F.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Leon Alonzo Frazier in court with attorney Eric m Hailstock.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 10.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Leon Alonzo Frazier in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
His attorney called and his son tested postive for COVID. His client showed up because he never received the text from is attorney. Court date for 6/16/2022 has been vacated. Case rescheduled both attorney and client have the new court date.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
